Frequently Asked Questions

Find quick answers to common questions

How do I apply for admission?

+

You can apply online through our admissions portal. Visit our website and click on "Apply Now" to get started with your application. The process includes submitting your academic transcripts, personal statement, and letters of recommendation.

What are the tuition fees?

+

Tuition fees vary by program and residency status. For undergraduate programs, annual tuition ranges from $15,000 to $25,000. Graduate programs range from $18,000 to $30,000. Please contact our admissions office for detailed information about fees and available financial aid options.

Are scholarships available?

+

Yes, we offer various merit-based and need-based scholarships. Merit scholarships are awarded based on academic achievement, while need-based aid considers your financial circumstances. We also have specialized scholarships for specific programs and underrepresented groups. Check our financial aid section for eligibility criteria and application processes.

What campus facilities are available?

+

Our campus features state-of-the-art facilities including modern classrooms with smart technology, well-equipped laboratories, a comprehensive library with digital resources, fitness centers, sports facilities, multiple dining options, comfortable dormitories, student centers, and recreational areas for student activities.

What support services are available for students?

+

We provide comprehensive support services including academic advising, career counseling, mental health services, tutoring centers, disability services, international student support, and 24/7 campus security. Our goal is to ensure every student has the resources they need to succeed.
